item.title: Code Block Click Copy
item.description: How to swap a Clipboard.js dependency for vanilla JavaScript

item.title: Tum | Modo | Postea
item.description: A retrospective look at what I came from, assessment of where I currently am, and a prospective look at where I see myself going

item.title: I Tried Working at 30,000ft
item.description: The rare occasion of me traveling alone came up and I was excited to have a few hours alone with my thoughts and make the most of the opportunity to get loads of work done.

item.title: MySQL Database Migration to a Remote Server from a .gz mysqldump file
item.description: Some bugs only appear when your web application is truly tested out in production. The actual use cases of your data structure may differ from what you imagined, so make a dump of the prod DB and play around on a development server.

item.title: Send SMTP Mail from Hetzner Server with Firewall
item.description: Laravel Mail Working locally but not on server. Getting stream_socket_client timeout error. We must allow outgoing TCP Connections in Hetzner Firewall.

item.title: How to test protected functions with PHPUnit in your Laravel app
item.description: An essential part of developing an app is testing your code. My preferred method of testing my Laravel code is using PHPUnit and this is how I use reflection to test those ‘harder to reach’ protected and private methods inside classes.

item.title: Undefined type 'Spatie\Permission\Models\' . 'Permission' | 'Role' | 'HasRoles'
item.description: VSCode with intelephense throws a strange and hard to debug error when using the spatie/laravel-permissions package even when you follow the docs to the letter. Here is how to fix it.

item.title: Space is the Place: Reasons to explore Twitter Spaces
item.description: Space! The Final Frontier… but what if it is the beginning? Twitter spaces are a great way to meet and trade ideas with people from across the globe from the comfort of your sofa!

item.title: 3 things the best senior developers do
item.description: Working under the care of a more experienced developer can make or break a junior developer’s career. Here are 3 things the best senior developers do.

item.title: How to Unlock Formkit Multistep forms on a Laravel Inertia app with Vue 3
item.description: Formkit offers a great Multi-Step tool for building forms in your Vue app, but getting it to work inside a Laravel Inertia app is a little tricky. Here is how to get it running.

item.title: Common Function Comparisons in PHP
item.description: How do you decide between two functions that, at a glance, seem to do the same thing? Let’s pick apart the differences to try and make it easier.

item.title: 3 ways to read input with a Go CLI
item.description: Tutorial with examples showing 3 different ways to read user input when building a command line interface (CLI) with Go

item.title: AI as a Creator
item.description: A project using the bi-products of an ongoing AI application development.

item.title: New Side Project - AI as a Creator
item.description: Working with AI tools is taking the web development world by storm. This is how I plan to make use of it though.

item.title: Go CLI User Input Experiment
item.description: While building a CLI with Go, I ran a few little experiments without business logic to ensure that I was able to read user input exactly as expected.

item.title: Enkle Word Game
item.description: A game built using JavaScript based on the same concepts as Wordle. Designed to be customizable for my young son to enjoy.

item.title: SEO Keyword Content Analysis

item.title: How to make your GitHub project pop on social media
item.description: Half the battle of progressing your open source project is getting it noticed and attracting contributors. So make the most of this simple trick.

item.title: Why I won't use AI on this blog
item.description: Artificial Intelligence is the hottest topic in a long while and we are certain to see it creep into content on the web. However, I will try to avoid the trend.

item.title: Developing a Laravel Application using Tinker
item.description: The Laravel framework has a huge amount of helpful features, let’s take a deeper look at one of the most powerful. Tinker.

item.title: Energy Price News API
item.description: A project to create a public API that scrapes news sites for anything concerning the changes in energy prices.

item.title: Why use Docker for databases and how
item.description: Docker is an invaluable piece to add to any tech stack for a multitude of reasons, but it can often be confusing to work with. Here we’ll dive into my favourite way to use Docker containers and explain every step .

item.title: Re-reading my old blogs
item.description: Having finally made a site to house my own work, using old material from a year ago had some unexpected benefits.

item.description: It is what it is. Learn what you can.

item.title: If it doesn't make sense, build a little version
